ranked_diseases.explanation: Rett Syndrome is associated with intellectual disability and hypertonia. It predominantly affects females, but atypical forms or genetic mosaicism can affect males.
Coffin-Lowry Syndrome is characterized by intellectual disability and can also present with hypertonia. It is a consideration due to the presence of these overlapping symptoms.
Angelman Syndrome presents with intellectual disability and may include motor dysfunction leading to hypertonia. It is less common in males but still possible.
Mowat-Wilson Syndrome includes features such as intellectual disability and sometimes hypertonia. It is considered possibly due to the overlap in neurological symptoms.
